meanings.definition: Of or relating to fables or storytelling.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed the fabular stories before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: The fabular elements in the tale added a touch of magic.
meanings.sent3: The fabular twist at the end of the story made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was so fabular that she could create entire worlds.
meanings.sent5: The fabular nature of the narrative captivated the audience.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a fable or myth.
meanings.sent1: The ancient artifact had a fabular aura surrounding it.
meanings.sent2: The painting depicted a fabular scene from folklore.
meanings.sent3: The fabular symbols on the shield puzzled the historians.
meanings.sent4: His dreams often took on a fabular quality, like ancient legends.
meanings.sent5: The tapestry told a fabular tale of heroes and monsters.
